definition: to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
to work vaguely then retreat (idiom); sloppy and half-hearted/half-baked
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly

sentences.english: One woman said she had scribbled "California" on her paper.
sentences.chinese: 一个女人说她在纸上草草写了“加州”这个词。

sentences.english: There is no feeling that is too hasty to do.
sentences.chinese: 已经没有感觉了，就是做也是草草了事。

sentences.english: The mechanic did a quick and dirty repair on my car.
sentences.chinese: 那个机械师潦潦草草地修了我的车。

sentences.english: After leafing through the student's composition,the teacher pointed out some slight mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 在草草读完学生的作文以后，老师指出了一些小错误。

sentences.english: They knocked together two rough mailboxes with wooden boards.
sentences.chinese: 他们用木板草草地做成了两个粗糙的信箱。

sentences.english: He rough-hewed the resolution of the meeting and sent it to the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 他草草写出大会决议的提纲，然后把它交给主席。

sentences.english: They knocked together a rough box with wooden boards.
sentences.chinese: 他们用木板草草地做成了一个粗糙的箱子。

sentences.english: The leader just skimmed through the headlines of the report.
sentences.chinese: 这位领导只是草草过目了一下那份报告的标题。

sentences.english: The wrecked bicycle was patched up and resold.
sentences.chinese: 撞坏的自行车草草地修了一下就卖掉了。

sentences.english: Management dismissed the union's behavior as irresponsible and unreasonable.
sentences.chinese: 管理层把工会行为视作不负责任和无理要求草草处理。

sentences.english: Many college students used to rush through their summer fieldwork projects.
sentences.chinese: 很多大学生过去常常对暑期实地调查作业草草了事。

sentences.english: They railroaded the motion through the committee.
sentences.chinese: 他们使那项动议在委员会中草草通过。

sentences.english: MESSY end to Greece's debt crisis seems ever more plausible.
sentences.chinese: 希腊债务危机草草收场似乎比以往来得更有理有据。

sentences.english: Nice houses in Hoi An old town, which decorate with plants on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 惠安古镇里的房子，都有花花草草装饰着，非常漂亮。

sentences.english: Thirty minutes earlier, I triple-checked the address scrawled in my notebook.
sentences.chinese: 三十分钟前，我再三确认记事本上草草写就的地址。

sentences.english: A truce has been patched up.
sentences.chinese: 休战条约已草草订就了。

definition: to rush through the work/to get through a thing carelessly
to rush to conclude a matter/to end up abruptly
to work vaguely then retreat (idiom); sloppy and half-hearted/half-baked
to go home (in a ceremonial procession)/to return home
to skimp/to work half-heartedly/not to bother
